Description: Ebony 'shabti' of Hatsheret: the number of Osiride attributes of the figures is striking, including the mummiform stance and the epithet "true of voice," which translates as "justified" in the traditional religion. The beautiful ebony shabti is inscribed with the conventional shabti spell from the Book of the Dead naming "the Osiris, Hatsheret."
Curator's comments: Bibliography: R. E Freed, Y. J. Markowitz and S. H. D'Auria (eds.), 'Pharaohs of the Sun: Akhenaten, Nefertiti, Tutankhamun' [exhibition catalogue] (Boston/New York/London, 1999), p. 271 [239] = R. Freed, 'Farao's van de Zon' (Leiden, 2000), p. 271 [239].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1990 24 Mar-10 Jun, Australia, Canberra, National Gallery of Australia, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.45 1990 28 Jun-23 Sep, Australia, Melbourne, Museum of Victoria, Civilization: Ancient Treasures from the British Museum, cat. no.45 1999 14 Nov-2000 6 Feb, USA, Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Pharaohs of the Sun : Akhenaten Nefertiti Tutakhamen 2008 Oct-2009 Feb, Geneva, Musee d'art et d'histoire, Akhenaten. 2009 Feb-Jun, Turin, Palazzo Bricherasio, Akhenaten
